name: VocabCards app
descr: Mobile-friendly app to practice Korean words from my wordlist, using flashcards.

features.title: Data from Google Sheet
features.text: The app downloads the wordlist file directly from a published Google Sheet in TSV format which is then easily parsed by JavaScript.

features.title: Progress saved on server
features.text: The progress is saved in a JSON file on the server using arrays to store the indexes of the words.

features.title: Difficult Words
features.text: If a choice is not correct, the word goes into a separate array so the user can review those words later again.

features.title: Random, with a twist
features.text: The cards are picked randomly, but the different choices are programmed not to be so easy if possible - in case there are similar words in the list.

name: WebDictionary
descr: Web based dictionary app that uses my own word list as a resource. It is possible to search both ways without pre-setting the language, and an autocomplete function also helps to find the word or phrase needed. Try it now!

features.title: Data from Google Sheet
features.text: The app downloads the wordlist file directly from a published Google Sheet in TSV format which is then easily parsed by JavaScript.

features.title: Prioritized search algorithm
features.text: The search algorithm checks both languages, first looking for exact matches, then the word standing on its own, then anything starting with the word, and finally anything that contains the word.

name: CountDowns app
descr: As I wanted to practice using cookies and localStorage I created a tiny web application for managing countdown timers. Try it now!

features.title: User Account management
features.text: It is possible to sign up multiple users and manage their timers separately.

features.title: HTML5 Web Storage
features.text: All data is stored locally using the localStorage interface with the help of some cookies managing the login sessions.

name: All-in-one startpage
descr: A single page web app that contains all my most frequently used bookmarks and functionalities.

features.title: Welcome message
features.text: Stores user name and gets location and weather report by IP address.

features.title: Search boxes
features.text: In addition to Google I can search from all my bookmarks stored in a MySQL database or look up words in my Korean word list.

features.title: Notes
features.text: Notes app with functions like add new, update, archive or delete a note.

features.title: Link tiles
features.text: My most frequently used links in scrollable boxes with cool hover effects.

features.title: Notes for mobile
features.text: Lightweight mobile-friendly mini-app only to use the notes functionalities.

name: P-kin.com
descr: My first and biggest project yet is this website you're browsing now. I started to work on it long ago, and since then I'm always experimenting on it with new techniques.

features.title: Responsive design
features.text: It's fully responsive thanks to Bootstrap, so it should look fine on both desktops, tablets and mobile phones.

features.title: Animated elements
features.text: To make the site a bit more dynamic, I added some animations using both Bootstrap and jQuery.

features.title: Contact form
features.text: If you want to send a message to me there is a contact form available at the bottom using the mail functions of PHP.

features.title: Generating content from the server and from a database
features.text: Thanks to AJAX calls some of the content is generated by fetching data from MySQL database or from text files on the server.

name: MySQL database admin page
descr: Tailor made admin page to easily access tables and manipulate records in a MySQL database using PHP and JavaScript AJAX calls. For the design of the page I only used simple Bootstrap styling.

features.title: Basic functionality
features.text: All the CRUD operations and possibility to export table to a CSV file.

features.title: Access control
features.text: Anyone can view and search the database, but manipulating data is password protected.

name: Bullshit Generator
descr: It started out as a Java project at school, but I really liked the possibilities of the generator algorithms, so I decided to "translate" the program to JavaScript and created a nice colorful web UI for it. Try it now!

features.title: Multi-language
features.text: Both the UI, the source files and bullshit generator algorithms are available in Hungarian and English.

features.title: Read source text from files
features.text: As source text the user can choose from different pre-uploaded books from the server.

name: Node.js database API
descr: Basic API powered by a Node.js web server that allows a user to fetch data from an SQLite database and receive it in JSON format. It also has functionalities to manipulate the data or download the whole database.

features.title: URL routing
features.text: To search for a record or fetch a whole table it's enough to use the specific URL query string, like .../search/{word} or .../list/{tablename}.

features.title: Request handling
features.text: For features like updating or removing records, the server needs the appropriate parameters in the body of POST requests.

name: Dictionary desktop app
descr: Not a pretty one, but it's my first working, functional and useful desktop application. All written in Python, for the back-end part I used OpenPYXL, and the front-end is created by the Tkinter library.

features.title: Read data from Excel
features.text: The program is using my own word list that is stored in an Excel file.

features.title: Ability to add new words
features.text: In addition to search the dictionary, this app is also capable of adding and saving new word pairs to the recource file.
